Description: Ostracon, large section (three fragments joined) of the body of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, the fabric is grey in section and contains many small white inclusions, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of the remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as sweet wine of year 2 from the river-branch of Bah (?).
Curator's comments: Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 3, plate XC n. 165. Wahlberg, The Wine Jars Speak, p.122 n. 194
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393468) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393468)
